description: Gets details of the specified capacity task.

parameters.name: OutpostIdentifier
parameters.description: ID or ARN of the Outpost associated with the specified capacity task.

nested_items.name: CapacityTaskId
nested_items.description: ID of the capacity task.

nested_items.name: OutpostId
nested_items.description: ID of the Outpost associated with the specified capacity task.

nested_items.name: OrderId
nested_items.description: ID of the Amazon Web Services Outposts order associated with the specified capacity task.

nested_items.name: AssetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Outpost asset. An Outpost asset can be a single server within an Outposts rack or an Outposts server configuration.

nested_items.name: RequestedInstancePools
nested_items.description: List of instance pools requested in the capacity task.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type of the hosts.

nested_items.name: Count
nested_items.description: The number of instances for the specified instance type.

nested_items.name: InstancesToExclude
nested_items.description: Instances that the user specified they cannot stop in order to free up the capacity needed to run the capacity task.

nested_items.name: Instances
nested_items.description: List of user-specified instances that must not be stopped.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AccountIds
nested_items.description: IDs of the accounts that own each instance that must not be stopped.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Services
nested_items.description: Names of the services that own each instance that must not be stopped in order to free up the capacity needed to run the capacity task.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DryRun
nested_items.description: Performs a dry run to determine if you are above or below instance capacity.

nested_items.name: CapacityTaskStatus
nested_items.description: Status of the capacity task.
REQUESTED - The capacity task was created and is awaiting the next step by Amazon Web Services Outposts.
IN_PROGRESS - The capacity task is running and cannot be cancelled.
FAILED - The capacity task could not be completed.
COMPLETED - The capacity task has completed successfully.
WAITING_FOR_EVACUATION - The capacity task requires capacity to run. You must stop the recommended EC2 running instances to free up capacity for the task to run.
CANCELLATION_IN_PROGRESS - The capacity task has been cancelled and is in the process of cleaning up resources.
CANCELLED - The capacity task is cancelled.

nested_items.name: Reason
nested_items.description: The reason that the specified capacity task failed.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of failure.

nested_items.name: CreationDate
nested_items.description: The date the capacity task was created.

nested_items.name: CompletionDate
nested_items.description: The date the capacity task ran successfully.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedDate
nested_items.description: The date the capacity task was last modified.

nested_items.name: TaskActionOnBlockingInstances
nested_items.description: User-specified option in case an instance is blocking the capacity task from running. Shows one of the following options:
WAIT_FOR_EVACUATION - Checks every 10 minutes over 48 hours to determine if instances have stopped and capacity is available to complete the task.
FAIL_TASK - The capacity task fails.
